title: Identify User
description: Set the user ID for a particular device ID or update user properties without sending an event to Amplitude.

user_id.description: (required unless device_id is present) A UUID (unique user ID) specified by you. Note: If you send a request with a user_id that is not in the Amplitude system yet, then the user tied to the user_id will not be marked new until their first event.

device_id.description: (required unless user_id is present) A device specific identifier, such as the Identifier for Vendor (IDFV) on iOS.

user_properties.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs that represent additional data tied to the user in Amplitude. Each distinct value will show up as a user segment on the Amplitude dashboard. Object depth may not exceed 40 layers. Note: You can store property values in an array and date values are transformed into string values.

groups.description: (Enterprise only) This feature is only available to Amplitude Enterprise customers who have purchased the Amplitude Accounts add-on. A dictionary of key-value pairs that represent groups of users. Setting groups will allow you to use Amplitude's account-level reporting feature. Note: You can only track up to 5 groups. Any groups past that threshold will not be tracked.

app_version.description: What version of the app the user is on.

platform.description: What platform is sending the data.

os_name.description: What mobile operating system or browser the user is on.

os_version.description: What version of the mobile operating system or browser the user is on.

device_brand.description: What device brand the user is on.

device_manufacturer.description: What device manufacturer the user is on.

device_model.description: What device model the user is on.

country.description: What country the user is in.

region.description: What geographical region the user is in.

city.description: What city the user is in.

dma.description: The Designated Market Area of the user.

language.description: What language the user has set.

paying.description: Whether the user is paying or not.

start_version.description: What version of the app the user was first on.
